title: Jackson County Sheriff's Respond To 2 Hunting Accidents
content:
TOPEKA, Kan. (WIBW)-- Jackson County Sheriff’s investigated two separate hunting accidents Sunday.
The first involved three minors hunting when no adults were present at the time. About 7:40 a.m. Sheriff’s received a report of a 15-year-old being shot with turkey hunting. Three minors were hunting just north of 118th and B Road near Delia in Jackson County. A gun being held by a 10-year-old accidentally discharged wounding the 15-year-old in the leg. The victim was taken to a Topeka hospital. The victim is listed in stable condition.
The second accident occurred just before 11:30 a.m. Officials received a report of a man who had fallen out if his tree stand near 246th and G road near Soldier. Jackson County EMS transported the man to a Topeka hospital. He is in stable condition.
